meanings.definition: Sklented (adjective): having a slanted or tilted position
meanings.sent1: The bookshelf looked sklented after I accidentally bumped into it.
meanings.sent2: The picture frame hung sklented on the wall.
meanings.sent3: The sklented painting made the room feel a bit off-kilter.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was sklented, revealing a mischievous secret.
meanings.sent5: The sklented tree cast a long shadow in the afternoon sun.

meanings.definition: Sklented (verb): to tilt or slant in a particular direction
meanings.sent1: I sklented my head to get a better view of the stage.
meanings.sent2: The tower sklented slightly in the strong wind.
meanings.sent3: She sklented the mirror to check her reflection from different angles.
meanings.sent4: The old fence sklented towards the overgrown garden.
meanings.sent5: The boat sklented to the left as the waves rocked it gently.

meanings.definition: Sklented (noun): a slanted or tilted surface
meanings.sent1: The skateboard ramp had a sklented for added excitement.
meanings.sent2: The roof had a sklented that allowed rainwater to drain off easily.
meanings.sent3: The artist painted on a sklented to create a unique perspective.
meanings.sent4: The ski slope had a dangerous sklented that challenged even experienced skiers.
meanings.sent5: The table had a sklented that made it wobble slightly on uneven ground.
